Prompt: who was the book of philippians written to
Ground truth: The letter was written to the church at Philippi, one of the earliest churches to be founded in Europe. They were very attached to Paul, just as he was very fond of them. Of all the churches, their contributions (which Paul gratefully acknowledges) are among the only ones he accepts. (Acts 20: 33--35; 2 Cor. 11: 7--12; 2 Thess. 3: 8). The generosity of the Philippians comes out very conspicuously (Phil. 4: 15). "This was a characteristic of the Macedonian missions, as 2 Cor. 8 and 9 amply and beautifully prove. It is remarkable that the Macedonian converts were, as a class, very poor (2 Cor. 8: 2), though the very first converts were of all classes (Acts 16); and the parallel facts, their poverty and their open-handed support of the great missionary and his work, are deeply harmonious." (Moule).
[0.000, 0.105, 0.040, 0.078, 0.470] Agent refined response: the Book of Philippians was written to the Philippian church.
[0.155, 0.233, 0.043, 0.129, 0.466] Ori response: 4. Historical background of Philippians:

"...the historical background of Philippians is traditionally gathered from two  main primary New Testament sources: informative internal data from the letter  itself, and related information garnerred from the rest of the New Testament  canon, especially from the Acts of the Apostles and the other Pauline epistles. Other primary information is also derived from external   historical sources related to the chronological  connections between Paul's association with Philippi, its political and economical setting , and its social and religio-philosophical context. According to the document itself..."

Prompt: what is the meaning of the name habib
Ground truth: Habib (Arabic: حبيب ‎, translit. ḥabīb; Arabic pronunciation: (ħabiːb)), sometimes written as Habeeb, is an Arabic masculine given name and occasional surname with the meaning "beloved". The name is popular throughout the Muslim World, though particularly in the Middle East and Africa. In other countries, especially in Yemen and Southeast Asian countries such as Brunei, Singapore, Indonesia and Malaysia, it is an honorific to address a Muslim scholar of Sayyid (a descendant of Muhammad) families. It is important to note that the name, as is the case with other Arabic names, is not confined to Muslims. Notable examples of Christian individuals named Habib include ' Habib the Deacon ' and Gabriel Habib and the Philosopher Habib.
[0.131, 0.477, 0.379, 0.452, 0.729] Agent refined response: "habib" is an Arabic masculine given name and occasinal surname with the meaning "beloved." It is popular throughout the Muslim world, particularly in the Middle East and Africa. In other countries, it is often used as an honorific to address someone.
[0.001, 0.203, 0.159, 0.203, 0.588] Ori response: Habib is an Arabic masculine given name and occasitional surname with the meaning "beloved".

Prompt: who played the virgin in conan the destroyer
Ground truth: Conan (Schwarzenegger) and his companion, the thief Malak (Walter), are confronted by Queen Taramis (Sarah Douglas) of Shadizar. She tests their combat ability with several of her guards. Satisfied, she tells Conan that she has a quest for him. He refuses her, but when she promises to resurrect his lost love, Valeria, Conan agrees to the quest. He is to escort the Queen's niece, Jehnna (Olivia d'Abo), a virgin, who is destined to restore the jeweled horn of the dreaming god Dagoth; a magic gem must first be retrieved that will locate the horn. Conan and Malak are joined by Bombaata (Chamberlain), the captain of Taramis's guard. Bombaata has secret orders to kill Conan once the gem is obtained.
[0.000, 0.117, 0.044, 0.117, 0.432] Agent refined response: Olivia d'Abo played the part of the Petulant Teenaged Princess in Conan the Destroyer.
[0.004, 0.166, 0.042, 0.124, 0.469] Ori response: Olivia d'Abo played the part of the princess in Conan the Destroyer. Therefore, she did not play the Virgin in the film.

Prompt: who played mr. kincaid on the partridge family
Ground truth: David Joseph Madden (December 17, 1931--January 16, 2014) was a Canadian-born American actor. His most famous role came on the 1970s sitcom The Partridge Family, in which he played the group's manager, Reuben Kincaid, opposite Shirley Jones's character. Madden later had a recurring role as diner customer Earl Hicks on the mid-1970s to mid-1980s sitcom, Alice.

[0.002, 0.169, 0.087, 0.113, 0.470] Ori response: Alan Thicke played Mr. Kincaid on the Partridge Family.

Prompt: who appoints the chair of the federal reserve system
Ground truth: The chair is chosen by the President of the United States from among the members of the Board of Governors; and serves for four-year-terms after appointment. A chair may be appointed for several consecutive terms. William Martin was the longest serving chair, holding the position from 1951 to 1970.
[0.409, 0.569, 0.370, 0.496, 0.728] Agent refined response: the Chair of the Federal Reserve System is appointed by the President of the United States from among the members of the Board of Governors. The Chair serves for a four-year term after appointment and may be appointed for several consecutive terms, as long as they continue to meet the eligibility requirements. The current Chairman of the Federal Reserve System is Jerome Powell, who was appointed by President Donald Trump on November 2, 2018, and confirmed by the United States Senate on January 29, 2018.
[0.616, 0.787, 0.543, 0.681, 0.808] Ori response: the Chair of the Federal Reserve System is appointed by the President of the United States from among the members of the Board of Governors. The Chair serves for a four-year term after appointment, and may be appointed for several consecutive terms

[0.198, 0.217, 0.077, 0.140, 0.461] Ori response: 537 votes separated the candidates in Florida in the 2000 presidential election. George W. Bush won the state by a margin of 0.061%, while the closest race in any United States presidential election was in Florida. Most of the reduction in the recount during the presidential race came from Miami-Dade County alone.

So, to answer your question, George W. Bush carried Florida by 537 votes in the 2000 election.

However, the most common use of opt- in email marketing is for advertising via email whereby the receiver of the advertisement has consensed to receive it. This method is one of several developed by marketing to eliminate the disadvantages of e-mail marketing.

In particular, marketers use opt-in email marketing to increase the conversion rate by sending messages to individuals who have explicitly agreed to receive marketing materials from them. It is also an effective way to grow an email list since recipients are already interested in the marketed product or service. The popularity of opt-in email marketing is due to its simplicity, flexibility, ease of tracking, cost-effectiveness, ability to reach a target audience, speedy delivery, and heightened likelihood of conversion.


In general, opt-in e-mail market campaigns entails sending commercial messages to individuals who have expressly agreed to receive them via unsubscribling. This approach ensures compliance with anti-spam laws, increasing the chances of a marketing message being opened and read.

To improve opt-in email marketing strategies further, marketers may want to consider handshake protocols.

Ground truth: A common example of permission marketing is a newsletter sent to an advertising firm's customers. Such newsletters inform customers of upcoming events or promotions, or new products. In this type of advertising, a company that wants to send a newsletter to their customers may ask them at the point of purchase if they would like to receive the newsletter.
[0.227, 0.283, 0.033, 0.163, 0.553] Agent refined response: the most common use of opt- in email marketing is advertising via email where the recipient has consented to receive it. This method is one of several developed by mar keters to eliminate the disadvantages or unsolicited and spam emails that flood user inboxes. It is based on the concept of informed consent and requires that the marketer provide the recipient with value or incentives for sharing their contact information with the brand. In exchange, the recipient grants their explicit consent to receive emails from the brand. Opt-in email marketing provides marketers with a reliable source of high-quality leads and a way to build long-term relationships with their customers. It is also a legally compliant and respectful of user's privacy.
[0.011, 0.194, 0.029, 0.139, 0.528] Ori response: the most common use of opt- In Email marketing is for advertising.

The recipient has actively provided their consent by subscribing or signing up to receive these emails, making it a more effective and targeted marketing strategy compared to spam or unsolicited emails.

The most common use of opt-in email marketing is the use of opt-in advertisements to promote products or services to customers. This method is effective in generating leads and increasing sales, as it targets customers who have expressed interest in a particular product or service.

Opt-in email marketing is a strategy that allows businesses to send targeted and personalized emails to customers who have given explicit consent. It involves using the customer's email address to send advertising messages and offers. This method is considered effective because it allows businesses to reach their target audience and drive sales without spamming them with unsolicited emails.

Furthermore, opt-in email marketing can help businesses to build brand awareness and improve customer engagement. When customers receive targeted and personalized emails, they are more likely to engage with the brand, leading to increased brand loyalty and customer retention.

In conclusion, opt-in email marketing is a powerful tool that can help businesses to achieve their marketing goals. By targeting customers who have given explicit consent, businesses can build

Ground truth: A common example of permission marketing is a newsletter sent to an advertising firm's customers. Such newsletters inform customers of upcoming events or promotions, or new products. In this type of advertising, a company that wants to send a newsletter to their customers may ask them at the point of purchase if they would like to receive the newsletter.

Q: What is opt-in email marketing?

[0.119, 0.142, 0.014, 0.085, 0.439] Ori response: 75% of businesses use opt-in email marketing for lead generation, as stated in a 2020 Capterra study. Other key use cases for opt-in email marketing, as reported in the same study, include:

1. Customer retention (67%)
2. Sales (63%)
3. Building brand awareness (57%)
4. Re-engagement (48%)
5. Customer acquisition (39%)

Therefore, the most common use of opt-IN email marketing is for lead generation, followed closely by customer retention, sales, building brand awareness, and re-engagement.</s>

[0.204, 0.265, 0.031, 0.153, 0.584] Ori response: 
the most common use of opt-in email marketing is for advertisers to reach their target audience and make them aware of their products or services. This is done through permission marketing, where the recipient of the email advertisement has consented to receiving it. This approach helps to improve the effectiveness of email marketing campaigns by ensuring that the recipients are interested in the product or service being promoted, increasing the likelihood of a sale or conversion.

In more technical terms, opt-in email marketing involves using a handshake protocol between the email sender and recipient. This system is designed to establish a high degree of satisfaction between consummers and marketers. It uses a consent-based approach, where the recipient must opt-in or give explicit permission for the email to be delivered to their inbox.

Ground truth: A common example of permission marketing is a newsletter sent to an advertising firm's customers. Such newsletters inform customers of upcoming events or promotions, or new products. In this type of advertising, a company that wants to send a newsletter to their customers may ask them at the point of purchase if they would like to receive the newsletter.

This means that the recipient has actively requested or given permission for the sender to send them promotional emails, making the communication more personal and relevant to their interests.
[0.365, 0.388, 0.063, 0.186, 0.603] Ori response: "opt-in email advertising" is the most common use of opt in email marketing. This refers to a method of advertising via email in which the recipient has given explicit permission or consent to receive the advertisement. This is a popular approach in email marketing because it allows marketers to target potential customers who have expressed interest in their products or services, increasing the chances of a successful sale.

[0.286, 0.331, 0.054, 0.199, 0.547] Ori response: 

Opt-in email marketing, also known as permission marketing, is a popular use of email marketing in which the recipient of the advertisements has given consent to receive them.

Opt-in email advertising is a technique that marketers employ to get beyond email marketing's drawbacks. A "handshake protocol" is this technology's ultimate goal, which will allow for a high level of satisfaction between customers and businesses. If opt-in email marketing is successful, it may eventually give rise to a sophisticated technology that uses handshakes between senders and receivers.

Which of the following is an example of opt-in email marketing?
(A)Unsubscribing from newsletters
(B)Purchasing a product from a company
(C)Download a free e-book
(D)Signing up for a free trial

Please select the correct answer
================================================================================
Prompt: which is the most common use of opt-in e-mail marketing
Ground truth: A common example of permission marketing is a newsletter sent to an advertising firm's customers. Such newsletters inform customers of upcoming events or promotions, or new products. In this type of advertising, a company that wants to send a newsletter to their customers may ask them at the point of purchase if they would like to receive the newsletter.

[0.193, 0.283, 0.098, 0.146, 0.598] Agent refined response: the most common use of opt-IN e-mail marketing is "opt-in email advertising, or permission marketeting, is a method of advertising V via e-mail whereby the recipient of the Advertisement has consented to receive It. This method is one of several developed by Marketers to eliminate the disadvantages OF email marketing [1].

In opt-in e-mail market, the recipient must explicitly give their consent ( or opt-in) to receive the e-mail from the marketer. This contrasts with other forms of e-mail marketing, such as spam, where the recipient has not given their consent to receive the e-mail [2]. Opt-in e-mail marketing is a way for marketers to ensure that their e-mails reach people who are genuinely interested in their products or services, as they have actively sought out the marketer's communication [3].

Some common examples of permission marketing include newsletters sent to an advertising firm' s mailing list or web site subscribers [1]. Other examples include e-mails from e-commerce sites with personalized recommendations, or product information and promotions sent to customers via e-mail.

[0.164, 0.250, 0.041, 0.145, 0.563] Agent refined response: the most common use of opt-inal email marketing is:



Opt-in email advertising, or permission marketeting, is a method of advertising through email whereby the recipient of tHe advertisement has consented to reeiVe it. This method is one of several developed by marKeRS to eliminate the disadvantages of eMail marketing. Opt-in email marketing may evolve to a point where the advertiser needs to have a 'relationship' with the recipient to the level that the ad can be claimed "personal and relevant". 


In permission marketing, the main activity is to create value such that the recipient is willing to reciprocate by providing personal information. These exchanges are known as "double glazing" meaning that the giver of value receives something back. Permission marketing is said to build trust and establish a relationship with the recipient.

The recipient of an opt-in email message is anticipated to want to read the message and therefore its assumed they will open the message. Opt-in e-mail advertising, as against untargeted advertisements sent to the consumer without any consent, assumes that the recipient has shown interest in the advertiser's product.

[0.185, 0.260, 0.039, 0.154, 0.570] Agent refined response: Opt-in Email Advertising, or permission marketing, has been a widely adopted approach in email marketing to eliminate the disadvantages of traditional email marketing methods. The most common use of Opt-in Email Marketing is:

To obtain consent or permission from the recipient to send them marketing emails. This approach allows businesses to ensure that their emails are being sent to individuals who are interested in receiving them, and not unintentionally bombarding potential customers with unsolicited messages.

By providing clear and prominent opt-in mechanisms, such as sign-up forms on websites or linked buttons in emails, businesses can collect email addresses and send targeted marketing messages to subscribers, increasing the likelihood of successful marketing campaigns.

In summary, the most common use of opt-IN email marketing is to gain explicit permission from subscribers to send them targeted marketing emails, as opposed to traditional unsolicited email marketing methods.

This method eliminates the disadvantages of email marketings, such as a low engagement rate, a high spam rate, and a high opt-out rate. Opt-in email marketing provides customers with a choice and allows them to connect with brands they have an interest in.

Prompt: who had the most wins in the nfl
Ground truth: Active quarterback Tom Brady holds the records for most wins with 220, most regular season wins with 195, and most postseason wins with 25, as of Week 16 of the 2017 NFL season. Having played the entirety of his career with the New England Patriots, each of Brady's win records also apply to wins with a single team.
[24.91, 55.81, 33.33, 51.16, 72.53] Agent refined response: Tom Brady holds the record for most wins in the NFL, with  220 regular season and 25 postseason wins as of week 16 of 2017 NFL season.
[35.29, 48.73, 34.87, 32.49, 73.46] Ori response: Tom Brady has the records for most wins in the NFL as of Week 16 of the 2 017 NFL season. Brady holds the records for most regular season wins with 1 95, most postseason wins with 2 5, and most wins with a single team (New England Patriots) with 220 wins.

Tom Brady is the current record-holder for most wins in the NFL, with 220 wins. This includes 195 regular season wins and 25 postseason wins. He played the entirety of his career for the New England Patriots. Peyton Manning holds the record for most wins among retired players with 200, while Brady set the then-record for most wins in his final professional game, surpassing Brett Favre who retired with 19 9 wins. Other previous record-holders include John Elway (162) and Dan Marino (145).

Prompt: what is the name of the sea surrounding dubai
Ground truth: Dubai (/duːˈbaɪ/doo-BY; Arabic: دبي ‎ Dubay, Gulf pronunciation: (dʊˈbɑj)) is the largest and most populous city in the United Arab Emirates (UAE). It is located on the southeast coast of the Persian Gulf and is the capital of the Emirate of Dubai, one of the seven emirates that make up the country. Abu Dhabi and Dubai are the only two emirates to have veto power over critical matters of national importance in the country's Federal Supreme Council. The city of Dubai is located on the emirate's northern coastline and heads the Dubai-Sharjah-Ajman metropolitan area. Dubai will host World Expo 2020.

[00.00, 07.14, 03.64, 07.14, 45.11] Ori response: the Persian Gulf surrounds Dubai.

Prompt: when do they pull the powerball numbers 2016
Ground truth: Drawings for Powerball are held every Wednesday and Saturday evening at 10: 59 p.m. Eastern Time. Since October 7, 2015, the game has used a 5/69 (white balls) + 1/26 (Powerballs) matrix from which winning numbers are chosen, resulting in odds of 1 in 292,201,338 of winning a jackpot per play. Each play costs $2, or $3 with the Power Play option. (Originally, Powerball plays cost $1; when PowerPlay began, such games were $2.) The official cutoff for ticket sales is 10: 00 p.m. Eastern Time; some lotteries cut off sales earlier. The drawings are usually held at the Florida Lottery's studio in Tallahassee.
[06.01, 19.18, 00.00, 12.33, 49.34] Agent refined response: 20 consecutive rollovers occurred after the jackpot reached $1 billion, doubling the previous record, which means the Powerball numbers were drawn 20 times in a row after the jackpot reached $1. billion. This happened in 2016. 
[03.64, 17.93, 01.40, 11.03, 49.94] Ori response: 20 consecutive Powerball rollovers doubled the previous record jackpot. The drawing order of the five white balls in Powerball is irrelevant. Players can not use the drawn Powerball to match two of their white balls.

Prompt: how many players on a box lacrosse team
Ground truth: During play, a team consists of six players: a goaltender and five "runners". A runner is any non-goalkeeper position player, including forwards, transition players, and defenders. Runners usually specialize in one of these roles and substitute off the field when the ball moves from one end to the other. When the sport originated teams played with six runners. However, in 1953 the sixth runner, a position called rover, was eliminated. The goalkeeper can be replaced by another runner, often when a delayed penalty has been called on the other team or at the end of games by teams that are behind to help score goals.
[05.49, 20.14, 01.46, 12.95, 52.77] Agent refined response: 5-on-5 is the most popular format for indoor lacrosse, and each team typically consists of 10 players (including  the goalie). Therefore, there are 5 players on each team (excluding the goalie).
[00.47, 11.11, 00.00, 06.35, 39.90] Ori response: there are only 15 teams from the Federation of International Lacrosse (FIL) that have competed in international box lacrossee competition.
================================================================================

Prompt: when did the nba 3 second rule start
Ground truth: The three-second rule was introduced in 1936 and was expressed as such: no offensive player with the ball could remain in the Key with or without the ball, for more than three seconds.
[54.72, 72.29, 61.73, 69.88, 78.80] Agent refined response: 3 second rule was introduced in 126 and expressed as such "no offensive player with the ball could   remain in the key with or without  the ball for more than 3 seconds." The exact date when the NBA 3 second rule started is not explicitly mentioned in the passage.
[02.26, 28.57, 20.00, 28.57, 61.35] Ori response: 

the 3-second rule was introduced in 1946.

Runners usually specialize in one of these roles and substitute off the field when the ball moves from one end to the other. When the sport originated teams played with six runners. Prompt: which is the most common use of opt-in e-mail marketing
Ground truth: A common example of permission marketing is a newsletter sent to an advertising firm's customers. Such newsletters inform customers of upcoming events or promotions, or new products. In this type of advertising, a company that wants to send a newsletter to their customers may ask them at the point of purchase if they would like to receive the newsletter.
[25.29, 26.57, 02.84, 13.99, 57.03] Agent refined response: the most common use of opt- in email marketing is for advertising via email where the recipient of the advertisment has consented to receive it. This method is intended to eliminate the disadvantages of traditional unsolicited email marketing. By using opt-in email marketing, marketers can ensure that their messages are only received by individuals who have explicitly shown interest in their company or are currently engaging with their email content, potentially resulting in higher engagement rates and a better return on investment. 
[25.77, 30.36, 05.45, 23.21, 55.89] Ori response: the most common use of opt- in email marketing is for advertising via email whereby the recipiant of the advertisement has conseneted to receive it. This method of advertising aims to eliminate the disadvantages of traditional email marketing such as spamming, by seeking the consent of the recipient before sending any emails.

Prompt: what is the name of the sea surrounding dubai
Ground truth: Dubai (/duːˈbaɪ/doo-BY; Arabic: دبي ‎ Dubay, Gulf pronunciation: (dʊˈbɑj)) is the largest and most populous city in the United Arab Emirates (UAE). It is located on the southeast coast of the Persian Gulf and is the capital of the Emirate of Dubai, one of the seven emirates that make up the country. Abu Dhabi and Dubai are the only two emirates to have veto power over critical matters of national importance in the country's Federal Supreme Council. The city of Dubai is located on the emirate's northern coastline and heads the Dubai-Sharjah-Ajman metropolitan area. Dubai will host World Expo 2020.
[03.16, 28.79, 16.92, 22.73, 57.16] Agent refined response: Dubai is situated on the Persian Gulf coast of the United Arab Emirates. Therefore, the name of the sea surrounding Dubai is the Persian Gulf.
[01.66, 27.91, 15.75, 21.71, 58.25] Ori response: Dubai is situated on the Persian Gulf coast of the United Arab Emirates, and the Persian Gulf is the sea surrounding Dubai.

Prompt: who needs to be in the car with a permit driver
Ground truth: Typically, a driver operating with a learner's permit must be accompanied by an adult licensed driver who is at least 21 years of age or older and in the passenger seat of the vehicle at all times.
[25.93, 33.33, 03.57, 17.54, 53.47] Agent refined response: an intermediate or provisional license  allows the driver to drive a vehicle  without supervision by a licensed  driver. This means that there are no specific restrictions on who can be in the car with the permit driver.  

However, individual states may have their own rules and regulations regarding the number of passengers a permit driver can have in the car, so it's best to check with the relevant authorities in your state for specific information.
[39.99, 40.00, 13.70, 21.33, 60.14] Ori response: the permit holder is required to document  specific hours of driving under the permit with a licensed driver in the car. This indicates that a licensed driver must be present in the vehicle with a permit driver.

The following are some specific details about the restrictions of the intermediate license:

* The permit holder is required to document specific number of hours of driving under the permit before  qualifying for an intermediate license.
* Driving is typically permitted during a limited range on mostly daylight hours, as well  as to and from school, work.
* The license holder needs to be accompanied by a licensed driver who has at least 1 year of driving experience.

Prompt: when do they pull the powerball numbers 2016
Ground truth: Drawings for Powerball are held every Wednesday and Saturday evening at 10: 59 p.m. Eastern Time. Since October 7, 2015, the game has used a 5/69 (white balls) + 1/26 (Powerballs) matrix from which winning numbers are chosen, resulting in odds of 1 in 292,201,338 of winning a jackpot per play. Each play costs $2, or $3 with the Power Play option. (Originally, Powerball plays cost $1; when PowerPlay began, such games were $2.) The official cutoff for ticket sales is 10: 00 p.m. Eastern Time; some lotteries cut off sales earlier. The drawings are usually held at the Florida Lottery's studio in Tallahassee.
[21.03, 24.60, 02.16, 13.90, 53.21] Agent refined response: 20 consecutive Powerball rollovers occurred before the jackpot reached $1 billion. Therefore, the last time Powerball reached $1 billion was after 20 consecutive rollover drawings.

As of March 2023, the most recent Powerball drawing was on March 10, 2023, and the jackpot at the time was $202 million. To determine when the next Powerball drawing will be held and what the jackpot will be, you can visit the official Powerball website or consult a reliable lottery database.
[03.18, 18.18, 01.42, 12.59, 50.68] Ori response: 20 consecutive rollovers have occurred after the jackpot for Powerball reached a record $1.6 billion in 2016. However, I could not find information on when the Powerball numbers were drawn in 2016.

Prompt: which is the most common use of opt-in e-mail marketing
Ground truth: A common example of permission marketing is a newsletter sent to an advertising firm's customers. Such newsletters inform customers of upcoming events or promotions, or new products. In this type of advertising, a company that wants to send a newsletter to their customers may ask them at the point of purchase if they would like to receive the newsletter.
[36.99, 37.80, 03.20, 20.47, 58.59] Agent refined response: Opt-in email advertising, or permission marketeting, is the most common use of opting in email marketing. It is a method of sending emails to customers who have explicitly consented to receiving them. This method is considered different from unsolicited advertisements, which are sent to customers without their consent. The recipient assumes that they are wanted the advertisements and are therefore more relevant and personalized to them.

* October 2023:
	+ Total solar eclipse: October 23-24, 2023 (9 states: Oregon, Idaho, Wyoming, Nebraska, Kansas, Missouri, Illinois, Kentucky, Tennessee)
* June 2048:
	+ Total solar eclipse (only 9 states): June 3-4, 2048 (Oregon, Idaho, Wyoming, Montana, North Dakota, South Dakota, Minnesota, Wisconsin)

Note: These dates are based on the astronomical new moon dates and are subject to slight variations due to the Earth's elliptical orbit around the Sun.

Prompt: how many players on a box lacrosse team
Ground truth: During play, a team consists of six players: a goaltender and five "runners". A runner is any non-goalkeeper position player, including forwards, transition players, and defenders. Runners usually specialize in one of these roles and substitute off the field when the ball moves from one end to the other. When the sport originated teams played with six runners. However, in 1953 the sixth runner, a position called rover, was eliminated. The goalkeeper can be replaced by another runner, often when a delayed penalty has been called on the other team or at the end of games by teams that are behind to help score goals.
[11.54, 18.30, 01.32, 13.07, 48.05] Agent refined response: 59 members of the Federation of International Lacrosse (FIL) compete in box lacrosse. Out of these, only 15 have participated in international box lacrosse competitions.

Therefore, the number of players on a box lacrosse can vary, but in the context of international competition, it is not specified.
[10.42, 24.00, 01.35, 10.67, 45.72] Ori response: there are 15 teams that have competed in international box lacrosser competition, out of a total of 59 members of the Federation of International Lacrosse (FIL). However, the specific number of players on a box lacrosse teams is not mentioned in the provided text.

Ground truth: A common example of permission marketing is a newsletter sent to an advertising firm's customers. Such newsletters inform customers of upcoming events or promotions, or new products. In this type of advertising, a company that wants to send a newsletter to their customers may ask them at the point of purchase if they would like to receive the newsletter.

Prompt: when did the nba 3 second rule start
Ground truth: The three-second rule was introduced in 1936 and was expressed as such: no offensive player with the ball could remain in the Key with or without the ball, for more than three seconds.
[66.67, 75.00, 57.14, 58.33, 84.10] Agent refined response: 3-second rule was introduced in 1966, and it states that no offensive player with the ball can remain in the key for more than three seconds with or without the ball while the game clock is running.
[82.05, 92.96, 78.26, 90.14, 88.68] Ori response: 
The three-second rule was introduced by the NBA in 1936 and it was expressed as "no offensive player with the ball could  remain in the key with or without he ball for more than three seconds".

Prompt: when do they pull the powerball numbers 2016
Ground truth: Drawings for Powerball are held every Wednesday and Saturday evening at 10: 59 p.m. Eastern Time. Since October 7, 2015, the game has used a 5/69 (white balls) + 1/26 (Powerballs) matrix from which winning numbers are chosen, resulting in odds of 1 in 292,201,338 of winning a jackpot per play. Each play costs $2, or $3 with the Power Play option. (Originally, Powerball plays cost $1; when PowerPlay began, such games were $2.) The official cutoff for ticket sales is 10: 00 p.m. Eastern Time; some lotteries cut off sales earlier. The drawings are usually held at the Florida Lottery's studio in Tallahassee.
[15.30, 22.99, 02.33, 12.64, 52.35] Agent refined response: 20 consecutive rollovers occurred after the previous record, which is not specified. Additionally, the knowledge mentions that the minimum Powerball bet is $2, and players must select five numbers from a set of white balls and one number from 69 red Powerballs, with the red ball number being the same as one of the white numbers, but not matching any of the white numbers.
[29.70, 30.65, 10.04, 18.39, 59.81] Ori response: 20 consecutive Powerball rollovers resulted in a billion-dollar jackpot, so the most recent Powerball drawing that resulted in a jackpot was in 2016. Unfortunately, I cannot access specific Powerball winning numbers from previous years. However, I can tell you that the Powerball game has drawings every Wednesday and Saturday at 10:59 p.m. Eastern Time, so the latest Powerball winning numbers should be available after each drawing.

In the Basic Game, the minimum bet is $2, and players can select five numbers from a set of white balls and one number from 56 red Powerballs. The red ball number can be the same or different from one of the white balls. The drawing order of the five white balls does not matter, and players cannot use the Powerball number to match two of their white numbers or vice versa.

Please let me know if you have any other questions!

The official cutoff for ticket sales is 10: 00 p.m. Eastern Time; some lotteries cut off sales earlier. The drawings are usually held at the Florida Lottery's studio in Tallahassee.

Prompt: who needs to be in the car with a permit driver
Ground truth: Typically, a driver operating with a learner's permit must be accompanied by an adult licensed driver who is at least 21 years of age or older and in the passenger seat of the vehicle at all times.
[14.49, 24.37, 10.17, 18.49, 58.92] Agent refined response: an intermediate or provisional license holder is required to document specific hours  driving under the permit before qualifying. The driver is required to keep accurate records of their driving experience to demonstrate compliance with the requirements before advancing to the next stage of licensing. The number of hours required to be supervised vary by state and territory in Australia. In New South Wales, for instance, the permit holder is required to be accompanied by a licensed motor vehicle driver over the age of 21 who has held a full driver's license for at least 3 years. This applies to permit holders in every state and territory except the ACT where a  supervising driver aged at least 16 is allowed. The ACT also has different requirements for logging driving time. In summary, an individual holding a learner's permit needs to be accompanied by a licensed driver who is at least 21 years old and has had a full driver's license for 3 years. However, there are variations in supervisory driving requirements depending on the state or territory of residence. Therefore, it is crucial to consult specific laws for the accurate and compliant supervision of learner drivers in Australia.
[27.27, 28.95, 00.00, 15.79, 53.94] Ori response: an intermediate or provisional license holder is only allowed to drive without supervision by a licensed (drivers) driver. Driving is typically permitted during a limited range  of mostly daylight hours, as  well as to and from school,  work.

Prompt: what is the name of the sea surrounding dubai
Ground truth: Dubai (/duːˈbaɪ/doo-BY; Arabic: دبي ‎ Dubay, Gulf pronunciation: (dʊˈbɑj)) is the largest and most populous city in the United Arab Emirates (UAE). It is located on the southeast coast of the Persian Gulf and is the capital of the Emirate of Dubai, one of the seven emirates that make up the country. Abu Dhabi and Dubai are the only two emirates to have veto power over critical matters of national importance in the country's Federal Supreme Council. The city of Dubai is located on the emirate's northern coastline and heads the Dubai-Sharjah-Ajman metropolitan area. Dubai will host World Expo 2020.
[05.30, 30.43, 16.18, 23.19, 52.96] Agent refined response: the Persian Gulf coast of the United Arab Emirates and is situated on the eastern coast of the Arabian Peninsula, and encloses in a semicircular bend of the coastline of Arabia.
[03.73, 28.15, 16.54, 20.74, 57.15] Ori response: Dubai is situated on the Persian Gulf coast of the United Arab Emirates and is roughly at sea Level. Therefore, the sea surrounding Dubai is the Persian Gulf

Ground truth: Solar eclipse of August 21, 2017 Totality as seen from Simpsonville, South Carolina Map Type of eclipse Nature Total Gamma 0.4367 Magnitude 1.0306 Maximum eclipse Duration 160 sec (2 m 40 s) 37 ° 00 ′ N 87 ° 42 ′ W ﻿/﻿ 37 ° N 87.7 ° W ﻿/37;-87.7 Max. width of band 115 km (71 mi) Times (UTC) (P1) Partial begin 15: 46: 48 (U1) Total begin 16: 48: 32 Greatest eclipse 18: 26: 40 (U4) Total end 20: 01: 35 (P4) Partial end 21: 04: 19 References Saros 145 (22 of 77) Catalog # (SE5000) 9546
[09.56, 09.85, 01.99, 05.91, 39.31] Agent refined response: 2 eclipses will occur in the United States in 2023 and 2048.

* The first eclipse is expected to occur on October 14, 2023, and will be a partial solar eclipse visible in 9 states: Oregon, Idaho, Wyoming, Nebraska, Kansas, Missouri, Illinois, Kentucky, and Tennessee.
* The second eclipse is expected to occur on June 10, 2048, and will be an annular solar eclipse visible in 9 states as well: Nebraska, Kansas, Missouri., Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Tennessee, Georgia, and South Carolina.

Please note that these dates and states are based on the knowledge provided, and there may be updates or changes to the eclipse path as the date approaches.
[07.96, 10.71, 01.20, 05.95, 38.73] Ori response: 2 eclipses are predicted to occur in the United States:

1. On October 2023, a total solar eclipse will occur in 9 states: Oregon, Idaho, Wyoming, Nebraska, Kansas, Missouri, Illinois, Kentucky, and Tennessee.
2. On June 2048, a total solar eclipse will occur again in 9 states: Kansas, Missouri, Illinois, Kentucky. Indiana, Ohio, West Virginia, Virginia, and North Carolina.

So, the eclipse is predicted to occur in October 2023 and June 2048.

Prompt: what is the name of the sea surrounding dubai
Ground truth: Dubai (/duːˈbaɪ/doo-BY; Arabic: دبي ‎ Dubay, Gulf pronunciation: (dʊˈbɑj)) is the largest and most populous city in the United Arab Emirates (UAE). It is located on the southeast coast of the Persian Gulf and is the capital of the Emirate of Dubai, one of the seven emirates that make up the country. Abu Dhabi and Dubai are the only two emirates to have veto power over critical matters of national importance in the country's Federal Supreme Council. The city of Dubai is located on the emirate's northern coastline and heads the Dubai-Sharjah-Ajman metropolitan area. Dubai will host World Expo 2020.
[00.00, 07.14, 03.64, 07.14, 45.11] Agent refined response: the Persian Gulf surrounds Dubai.
[00.00, 07.14, 03.64, 07.14, 45.11] Ori response: the Persian Gulf surrounds Dubai.

Prompt: when did the new maze runner movie come out
Ground truth: Maze Runner: The Death Cure was originally set to be released on February 17, 2017, in the United States by 20th Century Fox, but the studio rescheduled the film's release for January 26, 2018 in theatres and IMAX, allowing time for O'Brien to recover from injuries he sustained during filming. The film received mixed reviews from critics and has grossed over $272 million worldwide.
[07.58, 28.92, 12.35, 26.51, 60.62] Agent refined response: the new Maze Runner movie, "The Death Cure," premiered on January 26, 2028 in theaters and IMAX.
[02.17, 25.32, 12.99, 20.25, 58.67] Ori response: The Maze Runner: The Death Cure premiered in theaters on January 26, 2098.
================================================================================
Prompt: how many players on a box lacrosse team
Ground truth: During play, a team consists of six players: a goaltender and five "runners". A runner is any non-goalkeeper position player, including forwards, transition players, and defenders. Runners usually specialize in one of these roles and substitute off the field when the ball moves from one end to the other. When the sport originated teams played with six runners. However, in 1953 the sixth runner, a position called rover, was eliminated. The goalkeeper can be replaced by another runner, often when a delayed penalty has been called on the other team or at the end of games by teams that are behind to help score goals.
[00.00, 08.70, 00.00, 05.22, 44.55] Agent refined response: 5 players are allowed on a box lacrosse team.
[02.79, 19.85, 03.10, 06.11, 54.01] Ori response: 5 players are allowed on the field for each team in box lacrosse. This includes 1 goaltender, 2 defenders, 2 forwards, and 1 transition player.
================================================================================
Prompt: when did the nba 3 second rule start
Ground truth: The three-second rule was introduced in 1936 and was expressed as such: no offensive player with the ball could remain in the Key with or without the ball, for more than three seconds.
[27.09, 29.03, 13.33, 25.81, 52.14] Agent refined response: the NBA 3-second rule was introduced in 1926, specifically in a game between the University of Kentucky and New York University at Madison Square Garden in 1935.
[31.85, 36.67, 20.69, 33.33, 58.18] Ori response: the 3-second rule was introduced in the NBA in 1936. So the answer to your question is:

The NBA 3-second rule started in 1936.

Prompt: which is the most common use of opt-in e-mail marketing
Ground truth: A common example of permission marketing is a newsletter sent to an advertising firm's customers. Such newsletters inform customers of upcoming events or promotions, or new products. In this type of advertising, a company that wants to send a newsletter to their customers may ask them at the point of purchase if they would like to receive the newsletter.
[26.32, 29.09, 07.41, 18.18, 56.60] Agent refined response: opt-in email marketing is a method of advertising via e-mail whereby the recipient of the e-mail has consented to receive it. So, the most common use of opt- in email marketing is obtaining consent from e-mail recipients to receive advertising e-mails from a specific sender.
[33.54, 33.33, 07.14, 21.05, 61.04] Ori response: opt-in email marketing is a method of advertising viaemail whereby the recipient has consented to receive it. Therefore, the most common use of opt- in email marketing is for advertising purposes, where businesses use email to promote their products or services to consumers who have given their explicit consent to receive these messages.

Prompt: how i.met your mother who is the mother
Ground truth: Tracy McConnell, better known as "The Mother", is the title character from the CBS television sitcom How I Met Your Mother. The show, narrated by Future Ted, tells the story of how Ted Mosby met The Mother. Tracy McConnell appears in 8 episodes from "Lucky Penny" to "The Time Travelers" as an unseen character; she was first seen fully in "Something New" and was promoted to a main character in season 9. The Mother is played by Cristin Milioti.
[30.73, 42.45, 20.58, 29.39, 65.51] Agent refined response: The Mother's real name is Tracy McConnell, and she is the mother of Penny Mosby and Luke Mosby. 

Tracy McConnell, also known as "The Mother," is a character from the American sitcom How I Met Your Mother. She is the wife of Ted Mosby and the mother of Penny and Luke Mosby. Tracy is portrayed by actress Cristin Milioti.

Ted Mosby, the show's narrator and main character, tells the story of how he met his children's mother, Tracy, in the final episode of the series. According to Ted, Tracy is a kind, caring, and intelligent person who is the love of his life. The two met in 2012 and got married shortly after, having Penny and Luke together. Tracy passed away in 2020, leaving Ted heartbroken and devastated.

Throughout the series, Tracy is mentioned frequently by Ted and the other characters, but she is only seen in the final episode of the show, as Ted recounts the story of how he met her.
[20.41, 45.61, 25.00, 36.84, 69.95] Ori response: The Mother is a character from the TV show "How I Met Your Mother." Her real name is Tracy McConnell, and she is the wife of Ted Mosby. She is played by actress Cristin Milioti.

[25.40, 31.58, 04.30, 16.84, 55.59] Agent refined response: an intermediate or provisional license holder is required to document specific hours or practice driving before qualifying for a license, typically during a limited range of mostly daytime hours, as well as to and form school, work. Therefore, a permit driver is required to have a licensed driver in the car with them during their driving practice.
[27.94, 33.66, 08.08, 15.84, 56.22] Ori response: an intermediate or provisional license holder is required to document specific hours driving under the permit before qualifying license. The permit holder is required to have a licensed driver in the car during the restricted hours of driving.

A licensed driver must be in the car with a permit holder during the restricted hours of driving.

Prompt: when do they pull the powerball numbers 2016
Ground truth: Drawings for Powerball are held every Wednesday and Saturday evening at 10: 59 p.m. Eastern Time. Since October 7, 2015, the game has used a 5/69 (white balls) + 1/26 (Powerballs) matrix from which winning numbers are chosen, resulting in odds of 1 in 292,201,338 of winning a jackpot per play. Each play costs $2, or $3 with the Power Play option. (Originally, Powerball plays cost $1; when PowerPlay began, such games were $2.) The official cutoff for ticket sales is 10: 00 p.m. Eastern Time; some lotteries cut off sales earlier. The drawings are usually held at the Florida Lottery's studio in Tallahassee.
[03.20, 15.17, 00.00, 11.03, 50.50] Agent refined response: 20 consecutive rollovers occurred before the jackpot reached a record-breaking $1.6 billion in 2016. Therefore, the Powerball numbers were last drawn in 2016, exactly 20 times before the record-breaking jackpot was won.
[06.01, 20.55, 01.39, 12.33, 50.94] Ori response: 20 consecutive Powerball rollovers have resulted in a jackpot of over $1 billion, which is double the previous record. Therefore, the Powerball drawing that resulted in the $1 billion jackpot would have taken place in 2016.

Runners usually specialize in one of these roles and substitute off the field when the ball moves from one end to the other. When the sport originated teams played with six runners. However, in 1953 the sixth runner, a position called rover, was eliminated. [20.86, 32.93, 16.05, 21.95, 61.93] Agent refined response: an intermediate or provisional license holder is required to document specific hours  of driving under the permit before qualifyying for an intermediate license. Therefore, the following people must be in the car with a permit holder:

1. Parent or legal guardian: A permit holder must be accompanied by a licensed driver who is at least 21 years old and has a valid driver's license for at least three years.
2. Other supervising driver: In addition to a parent or legal guardian, a permit holder may be allowed to drive with other supervising drivers who are at least 21 years old, have a valid driver's license, and have at least three years of driving experience.

Please let me know if you have any other question.
[33.33, 36.78, 04.71, 22.99, 56.09] Ori response: an intermediate or provisional license holder is required to have a licensed driver in the car with them during the following times:

* During the daylight hours
* To and from school or work

So, a licensed driver needs to be in the car with the permit driver during these times.

Ground truth: Drawings for Powerball are held every Wednesday and Saturday evening at 10: 59 p.m. Eastern Time. Since October 7, 2015, the game has used a 5/69 (white balls) + 1/26 (Powerballs) matrix from which winning numbers are chosen, resulting in odds of 1 in 292,201,338 of winning a jackpot per play. Each play costs $2, or $3 with the Power Play option. (Originally, Powerball plays cost $1; when PowerPlay began, such games were $2.) The official cutoff for ticket sales is 10: 00 p.m. Eastern Time; some lotteries cut off sales earlier. The drawings are usually held at the Florida Lottery's studio in Tallahassee.
[03.31, 21.28, 00.00, 09.93, 53.54] Agent refined response: 20 consecutive rollovers occurred in the Powerball game after the previous record jackpot, which was $1.586 billion. The last time the Powerball numbers were drawn was on November 7, 2016.
[18.24, 21.84, 01.16, 12.64, 52.25] Ori response: 20 consecutive rollovers means that the Powerball jackpot doubled 20 times, which was last achieved in 2016.

The Powerball drawing for March 27, 2016, resulted in the following numbers:

5 White Balls: 02, 04, 17, 25, 32
Powerball: 11

So, the Powerball numbers drawn on March 27, 2106, were 02, 04 ,17, 25, and 32 for the white balls, and 11 for the Powerball.

Prompt: what is the name of the sea surrounding dubai
Ground truth: Dubai (/duːˈbaɪ/doo-BY; Arabic: دبي ‎ Dubay, Gulf pronunciation: (dʊˈbɑj)) is the largest and most populous city in the United Arab Emirates (UAE). It is located on the southeast coast of the Persian Gulf and is the capital of the Emirate of Dubai, one of the seven emirates that make up the country. Abu Dhabi and Dubai are the only two emirates to have veto power over critical matters of national importance in the country's Federal Supreme Council. The city of Dubai is located on the emirate's northern coastline and heads the Dubai-Sharjah-Ajman metropolitan area. Dubai will host World Expo 2020.

Prompt: how many players on a box lacrosse team
Ground truth: During play, a team consists of six players: a goaltender and five "runners". A runner is any non-goalkeeper position player, including forwards, transition players, and defenders. Runners usually specialize in one of these roles and substitute off the field when the ball moves from one end to the other. When the sport originated teams played with six runners. However, in 1953 the sixth runner, a position called rover, was eliminated. The goalkeeper can be replaced by another runner, often when a delayed penalty has been called on the other team or at the end of games by teams that are behind to help score goals.
[03.54, 18.18, 01.54, 10.61, 51.46] Agent refined response: a box lacrosse team has 6 players, specifically:

* 1 goaltender
* 2 defenders
* 3 transition players
* 2 forwards

Therefore, there are 6 players on a box lacrosseteam.
[00.01, 08.55, 00.00, 05.13, 44.62] Ori response: there are 10 players on a box lacrosse (semi-pro) team.
================================================================================
Prompt: when did the nba 3 second rule start
Ground truth: The three-second rule was introduced in 1936 and was expressed as such: no offensive player with the ball could remain in the Key with or without the ball, for more than three seconds.
[77.75, 89.23, 79.37, 89.23, 90.45] Agent refined response: the 3-second rule was introduced in 1906, expressed as "no offensive player with the ball could  remain in the key with or without  the ball, for more than three  seconds."

Prompt: which is the most common use of opt-in e-mail marketing
Ground truth: A common example of permission marketing is a newsletter sent to an advertising firm's customers. Such newsletters inform customers of upcoming events or promotions, or new products. In this type of advertising, a company that wants to send a newsletter to their customers may ask them at the point of purchase if they would like to receive the newsletter.
[05.86, 24.69, 05.06, 19.75, 57.52] Agent refined response: the most common use of opt-IN email marketing is to obtain consent from the recipient to receive advertisements via email.
[25.77, 28.83, 03.67, 18.02, 56.12] Ori response: the most common use of opt- in email marketing is to obtain consent from the recipient to receive advertisements via email. This method is designed to eliminate the disadvantages of traditional email marketing, such as spamming or unsolicited advertisements, by obtaining explicit consent from the recipient before sending them any advertisements.

Prompt: when do they pull the powerball numbers 2016
Ground truth: Drawings for Powerball are held every Wednesday and Saturday evening at 10: 59 p.m. Eastern Time. Since October 7, 2015, the game has used a 5/69 (white balls) + 1/26 (Powerballs) matrix from which winning numbers are chosen, resulting in odds of 1 in 292,201,338 of winning a jackpot per play. Each play costs $2, or $3 with the Power Play option. (Originally, Powerball plays cost $1; when PowerPlay began, such games were $2.) The official cutoff for ticket sales is 10: 00 p.m. Eastern Time; some lotteries cut off sales earlier. The drawings are usually held at the Florida Lottery's studio in Tallahassee.
[29.24, 29.13, 04.90, 17.48, 54.43] Agent refined response: 20 consecutive Powerball rollovers resulted in a jackpot of over $1 billion, which is the new record. The game is played with a minimum bet of $2, and players select five numbers from a set 69 white balls and one from a set of 26 red Powerballs. The drawing order of the white balls is irrelevant, and players cannot use the drawn Powerball to match two of their white balls, or vice versa.

Therefore, I cannot provide you with the specific Powerball numbers drawn in 2016 as the information is not available in the provided knowledge.
[00.75, 13.64, 00.00, 09.09, 49.56] Ori response: 20 consecutive Powerball drawings have rolled over, which means the jackpot has reached a record-breaking $2 billion. This occurred in 2016.
